data.title: Start two Godot instances Editor-Debug -> output empty
data.body:
When I start godot twice to work on client/server(two projects) only one of both outputs is working.
The terminal is showing the output but not the editor.
Can anyone confirm this?

Does it have something to do with the default port(already in use..)? I can't see any errors.

OS: Ubuntu 64-bit, XUbuntu 

EDIT:
Still an issue in 3.0
** Error listening on port 6007 **

data.title: Doc HTTPClient.get_response_headers_as_dictionary()
Show driver information in verbose mode
data.body: This helps to debug graphics crashes (issue #1162)

data.title: Fixed hardware-accelerated skinning support.
data.body: I assumed this feature was broken in more in profound ways, but after studying it, attempting to understand how it worked, and what possible stages were broken, in the end it turned out to be a trivial single line fix. So yes, this re-enables GPU skinning on supported hardware, and while I'm still suffering from other performance issues, profiling this with a large number of skinned meshes does make a difference. I also added a check for ARB varient of the texture_float extension, since the OES one it currently checks for does not seem to be supported on most PC hardware.

data.title: Rename input actions by editing its item in the list
data.body:
Closes #3682

Input action items became editable after 908f75c. This caused the confusion you see in the above issue.

To solve this, I removed the old rename dialog and the rename button. Now actions are renamed by editing the item in the tree.

Input preset items are not editable. This could be confusing for some users (as discussed with @akien-mga on irc). A solution could be to make them editable, but show an error message after confirming the edition (e.x.: "Input presets cannot be renamed").

data.title: fix xinput triggers not resetting correctly
data.body: fixes #3683

data.title: Curve2D : get_baked_points() : not starting at first point.
data.body:
When points are added to a Curve2D, the function get_baked_points() won't start at the very first added point. Instead, the first point is set fixed after reaching bake interval the first time.

For example: adding points Vector2(0,0)...Vector2(13,0) with bake interval set to 10 will end in baked points: Vector2(10.000001,0) and Vector2(13,0).

The last point is always alternating, until a new interval is reached, what feels fine. But I think, that the starting point of the curve must not be alternating.

[curve2d_demo.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/128000/curve2d_demo.zip)

data.title: Runtime generated shapes in Area2D won't overlap or enter.
data.body:
Somehow, an Area2D won't recognize other Area2D that get their shapes during runtime.
I've added an example (godot 2.0 rc1) with different tries to get it work.

[area_collision_shapes_test.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/127796/area_collision_shapes_test.zip)

data.title: Enhance instructions for contributors
XBox 360 triggers report wrong analog value after pressed
data.body:
In the joysticks demo, axis 6 and 7 start with a value of 0.0. They show correct values while I press one or both triggers. But once released after pressing, they will default to 0.5 in idle position (instead of 0.0).

I'm using a XBox 360 Wireless Receiver with an XBox 360 Wireless Gamepad on Windows 10 and the latest godot version (2.0 RC1, 09 February 2016 12:22 AM).

data.title: Renaming actions in Input Map doesn't work
data.body:
Clicking on the name of an action in the Input Map lets you rename the action, but the rename doesn't actually do anything and reverts when restarting Godot.

Godot 2.0 RC1 on Linux Mint 17.3

data.title: Recent Projects in Project Manager doesn't often re-pose items after running or editing projects
data.body:
But it sometimes works. And I haven't noticed some factor that could cause working or not working.
In "editor_settings.xml", recent projects are always being written.
Adding favorites always works.

data.title: Particles (3D):: The color phases don't work
data.body:
To give more information, the color phase feature in the 3D particle settings are broken for all channels including alpha (though the 2D particles work just fine).

A screenshot to illustrate the problem
![godot_bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10081256/12997295/7903051e-d0fd-11e5-9f62-35e43b5dd446.jpg)

---

To see for yourself, simply open the 3D navmesh demo (in the pack of demos available from the main site) and inspect the particle object. The object already has color phases set, but none of them work.

This has been an issue for a while (at least since version 1), so it would be nice to see it fixed for version 2.

data.title: Parsing error when using 'not in'
data.body:
line 19 always gives me an error(19,19): ':' expected at the end of line

`if component.type() not in database.keys():`

This happens in everything I have tried `not in` with code wise.  A helpful forum user pointed out another way to make it work http://godotengine.org/topics/14086 but I feel like this should be correct usage.
[entitymanager.gd.txt](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/127332/entitymanager.gd.txt)

data.title: Errors in the Editor from core classes?
data.body:
I'm getting two odd errors reported in the debugger when working with the release candidate, these errors don't appear to be related to anything in my project, the errors are always present when I'm working in this release candidate, if this error isn't present for others I'm not sure how to recreate the issue. System is Windows 10, graphics card is Geforce 780. Here are the specific errors being reported:

Type: Error
Description:
Time: 0:00:00:0340
C Error: Condition '!elem' is true. returned: __null
C Source: core/rid.h:146
C Function: get

Type: Error
Description:
Time 0:00:00:0342
C Error: Condition '!texture' is true
C Source drivers/gles2/rasterizer_gles2.cpp:1268
C Function: texture_set_flags

data.title: Particles (3D) are never paused
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Add a Particle system to your 3d scene
2. setup a way to pause the game
3. run and pause the game. The particle system is still running as usual

Particles2D are working fine and are paused correctly.

data.title: Editing a script without having an open scene results in odd behaviour
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. open a scene
2. open a script from that scene
3. close all scenes
4. attempt to save any change to that script (or any other script)

If we can re-use scripts in more than one scene, it doesnt make sense not to allow editing scripts without an open scene. Right now, without opened scenes, the script editor is unusable.

data.title: Navigating an Itemlist with keyboard results in strange behavior
data.body:
When navigating through an itemlist with the keyboard the selected item becomes hidden.

For example in this item list with 14 test items navigating down to item 10 with the down key results in the following correct behavior.
![1_003](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11148529/12987919/489dd452-d0cc-11e5-8570-e06f3d620f10.png)

If I try to go down one more item this happens
![1_004](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11148529/12987983/a0e39214-d0cc-11e5-86c2-2857f0eac060.png)
In the above picture item 11 is selected but is not visible due to the itemlist not scrolling down enough. If I continue to go down the selected item is always hidden. Here I've navigated down to 14 using the down key.
![1_005](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11148529/12988020/dd26a810-d0cc-11e5-8c7d-7cb02837030f.png)

Navigating up results in the same behavior. Here I moved back up to item 1 but it is hidden.
![1_006](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11148529/12988069/09da8e3a-d0cd-11e5-8b8b-00feb589c0ee.png)

data.title: Links are only clickable under public methods in editor help

Tiny issue but frustrating in some cases

data.title: Godot 2.0 Beta/RC1 Tileset Collision Bug
data.body:
Hello! unfortunately I've ran into finding a problem while testing the _convert to_ options in Godot, apparently it doesn't allow the collision object to be exported to the res or tres file. The tres file reads:

```
[gd_resource type="TileSet" load_steps=2 format=1]

[ext_resource path="res://icon.png" type="Texture" id=1]

[resource]

0/name = "Sprite"
0/texture = ExtResource( 1 )
0/tex_offset = Vector2( 0, 0 )
0/region = Rect2( 0, 0, 0, 0 )
0/occluder_offset = Vector2( 32, 32 )
0/navigation_offset = Vector2( 32, 32 )
0/shape_offset = Vector2( 0, 0 )
0/shapes = [  ]

```

Shapes (A.K.A. collision) is not saved during the Convert to progress, both CollisionShape2D and CollisionPolygon2D doesn't work anymore. resulting on one of the kinematic characters I've been testing with to phase through the floor.

Has anybody noticed that exporting collisions to tilesets doesn't work? I've tried this on both the 32 and 64 bit Windows version on the RC1 release version already. Just for heads up before the final 2.0 is released.

data.title: Scene Animation Import plugin is not yet implemented though the class definition is there
data.body: The code for this seems to be empty. I guess it would be nicer to remove it from the menu or else people click and nothing happens
